sentences: See väike kass on armas ja sõbralik.
context: The Estonian word 'armas' is an adjective that describes something or someone as dear, lovely, sweet, or charming. It's often used to express affection and endearment toward children, pets, or loved ones. The word can be used in both singular and plural forms (armas/armed) and changes depending on the gender of the noun it modifies. In Estonian grammar, 'armas' would typically take the appropriate adjective endings based on the case number and gender of the noun it describes.
